[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: public_parameters] [Parameter mismatch] If different nodes use slightly different public parameters, can this cause DKG to produce inconsistent keys across the network? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Replay attacks] Can an attacker replay old transcripts from previous DKG sessions to disrupt current session or cause key reuse? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Session binding] Are transcripts properly bound to their DKG session ID to prevent cross-session attacks? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [BCS serialization] Can malformed BCS-encoded transcripts cause deserialization to accept invalid data or panic? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Arkworks serialization] Do ark_se/ark_de properly validate group elements during serialization/deserialization? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: keys] [Compression attacks] Can decompression of curve points introduce vulnerabilities or accept invalid points? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: public_parameters] [Skipped fields] Does skipping table and powers_of_radix during serialization cause desync issues if they're rebuilt incorrectly? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: transcript] [Size validation] Are vector sizes validated during deserialization to prevent memory exhaustion attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/mod.rs] [Module: chunked_elgamal] [CodomainShape deserialization] Can nested Vec<Vec<T>> structures in CodomainShape cause quadratic blowup in memory usage? (Medium)
